item.name: createPatient

request.description:
This function creates a patient made up of randomised variables, consiting of: 

- given name
- family name
- address lines (5 lines in total)
- postcode
- gender
- birthdate

it can be used to create a Patient using the Personal Demographics service - HL7 V3 API

Search

exec: /*data variables being checked against.  These shall be replaced by the variables set when HL7 is plugged in*/

request.description:
This test validates that all Patient Demographic data is mapped correctly to the Fhir PDF response, specifically:

* resourseType
* patientId
* identifierExtention
* metaVersionId
* nameFamily
* nameGiven
* prefix - specifically Spine "Dame" = PDS Fhir "Dame"
* suffix
* nameUse - specifically Spine nameType "Usual name" = PDS Fhir nameUse "usual"
* namePeriodStart
* gender - specifically Spine gender "female" = PDS Fhir nameUse "female"
* birthDate
* deceasedDateTime
* addressLines
* addressPeriodStart
* addressUse - specifically Spine addressType "usual" = PDS Fhir addresUse "home"
* postCode
* telecomSystem - specifically Spine telecomType "telephone" = PDS Fhir telecomSystem "phone"
* telecomUse - specifically Spine telecomUse "home" = PDS Fhir telecomUse "home"
* telecomPeriodStart
* telecomValue
* deceasedDateTime if - if present for Patient
* generalPractitionerValue - if present for Patient
* deathNotificationValueDateTime - if present for Patient

item.description:
Every result includes a score from 0 to 1.

Scores less than 1 can happen when parameters supplied do not exactly match the values on the patient record. Results are sorted best-first. You can request to only return exact matches (score = 1) using the _exact-match parameter.

item.name: max-results
Search query resulting in >50 patients being matched returns TOO_MANY_MATCHES

request.description: Search query which results in over 50 patients being matched, returns a *TOO_MANY_MATCHES* error

item.name: Search query resulting in more matched patients then max-results value returns TOO_MANY_MATCHES

request.description: Search query which matches more patients then the max-results value returns a *TOO_MANY_MATCHES* error

item.name: Empty max_results value returns INVALID_VALUE

request.description: Empty (\' \') *max-results* value returns a *INVALID_VALUE* error

item.name: Over 50 max_results value returns INVALID_VALUE

request.description: *Max-results* value of 51 returns an *INVALID_VALUE* error

item.description:
By default, the endpoint will return a maximum of 50 results.

If there are more than 50 matching patient records, the endpoint will return no results and the error response TOO_MANY_MATCHES. You can choose to limit the number of results returned using the _max-results parameter.

item.description:
The search will perform phonetic matching on names using soundex, transpose names, and score the results. If the fields death-date or general-practitioner are provided they will be ignored in this search. This search is performed using a combination of parameters. If an invalid combination is supplied _INVALID_COMBINATION_ will be returned.

- Matching common homophones, such as ‘Smith’ and ‘Smythe’
- Checking for transposed names, such as ‘Adam Thomas’ and ‘Thomas Adam’
- Phonetic matching using soundex

item.description: Every matched patient in the results list includes a score to indicate how closely the patient matched the search parameters. A score of 1.0 indicates an exact match. A score of less than 1.0 indicates a partial match. The result list is sorted in descending score order - best match first.

item.name: Search matching multiple patients including invalid patient does not return invalid patients record

request.description:
Invalidated NHS Patient number : 5900006107

> GIVEN I perform a Search  
AND that matches multiple patients  
AND one of those patients is a invalid patient  
WHEN I get the response  
THEN the invalid patients record is not returned

item.name: Search matching sensitive patient returns security object

request.description:
> GIVEN I perform a Search
AND that matches a Sensitive patient
WHEN I get the response  
THEN the Patients record includes the meta.security array  
AND the array includes the **R** *restricted level*

item.name: Search matching invalid patient only, results in patients data not being returned

request.description:
**NHS Number: 5900006107**

> GIVEN I perform a Search  
AND that matches one patient
AND that patient is a invalid patient  
WHEN I get the response  
THEN the invalid patients details are not returned

item.name: Retrieve
Retrieve Patient - Happy path 1

exec: /*data variables being checked against.  These shall be replaced by the variables set when HL7 is plugged in*/

request.description:
This test validates that all Patient Demographic data is mapped correctly to the Fhir PDF response, specifically:

* resourseType
* patientId
* identifierExtention
* metaVersionId
* nameFamily
* nameGiven
* prefix - specifically Spine "Dame" = PDS Fhir "Dame"
* suffix
* nameUse - specifically Spine nameType "Usual name" = PDS Fhir nameUse "usual"
* namePeriodStart
* gender - specifically Spine gender "female" = PDS Fhir nameUse "female"
* birthDate
* deceasedDateTime
* addressLines
* addressPeriodStart
* addressUse - specifically Spine addressType "usual" = PDS Fhir addresUse "home"
* postCode
* telecomSystem - specifically Spine telecomType "telephone" = PDS Fhir telecomSystem "phone"
* telecomUse - specifically Spine telecomUse "home" = PDS Fhir telecomUse "home"
* telecomPeriodStart
* telecomValue
* deceasedDateTime if - if present for Patient
* generalPractitionerValue - if present for Patient
* deathNotificationValueDateTime - if present for Patient
* Nominated Pharmacy - if present for Patient
* Medical Appliance Supplier - if present for Patient
* Communication Language - if present for Patient

request.description:

* resourseType

* Communication Language - if present for Patient

item.name: Retrieve Patient - Happy path 9 - Superceded

exec: /*data variables being checked against.  These shall be replaced by the variables set when HL& is plugged in*/

request.description:
This test validates that all Patient Demographic data is mapped correctly to the Fhir PDF response, specifically:

* If the Patient record is marked as Superceded, the response shall return the Retained record for the Patient
* nameUse - specifically Spine nameType "usual name" = PDS Fhir nameUse "official"
* namePeriodStart
* nameFamily
* nameGiven
* gender - specifically Spine gender "not specified" = PDS Fhir nameUse "other"
* birthDate
* addressLines
* addressPeriodStart
* addressUse - always returns "home" address only even though there may be other address associated with the Patient
* postCode
* resourseType
* patientId
* identifierExtention
